moves.1. e4 e5 2. Bc4 Bc5: Good responce but black look's are in trouble
moves.3... g6: A very bad move, Nh6 was better but I still win the e5 pawn
moves.4... Be7: But not a very good responce
moves.6. d4: You can see what I'm up to, or can you?
moves.6... d6: That stops mate in 3 but it doesn't fit well in development. White is winning anyway.
moves.7. Bh6+: Even though the knight can take me, it's pinned to the king, so it can't.
moves.7... Ke8: So now you know why I said d6/d5 foiled my plan. Now there's an escape square for the king.
moves.8... Kd7: Who want's an exchange of queens when white's this powerful. Of course not. So I end up..
moves.10. Bg5: The bishop is pinned twice. Once by the queen on f7, pinning it to its king, and the bishop and g5, pinning it to its queen. The world of pins arrive. And the king can't move.
moves.10... Nxd4: Bad move as it loses protection on the bishop.
moves.12. Nb5: See, as I can scoop on the risk of Nxb5, Bxb5+ check and its not good.
moves.12... Nxc2+: Oh, but my rook is'nt powerful yet.
moves.14. Be6+: Getting the king out to the centre.
